column4: firefox uses the same rendering engine in windows and linux ?
images like pixelated in ubuntu, is there a way to smooth them ?
i'd imagine so
press ctrl + minus key
also try: View > Zoom > Zoom text only
what version of firefox?
https://answers.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+question/37453
which firefox are you running?
good its the stable release
ok try: killall firefox; mv ~/.mozilla ~/.mozilla_old; firefox $
this will rename your firefox profile just to test
we can rename it back
i assume nothing in here
doesn't help
ok, delete the newly created profile folder and rename back so you have your original profile folder
so we know its not profile related
sudo apt-get clean; sudo apt-get --reinstall install firefox
is firfox ok now?
no that didn't change anything either
you could completely uninstall (and purge) firefox and all its dependancies, then reinstall it
sudo apt-get --purge remove firefox; sudo apt-get --purge autoremove; sudo apt-get clean; sudo apt-get install firefox
you may want to use   -t ntfs-3g
that is detected pretty easily these days
